The problem states: "The scientist carried out a cross between two guinea pigs, both of which have black coats. Black hair coat is dominant over white. Three quarters of the offspring have black coats, and one quarter have white coats."

Given that the parents are both black, their genotype possibilities are:

1. Both parents are Bb → 25% BB (black), 50% Bb (black), 25% bb (white) → 75% black.
2. One parent is Bb and the other is bb → 50% Bb (black), 50% bb (white).
3. Both parents are BB → 100% black.
